definition: first-class
(prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Philology prevailed very much in Qing Dynasty and especially many top-ranking scholars ever studied it at that time.
sentences.chinese: 清代小學極其昌盛，第一流的學者對小學均多所研究。

sentences.english: He is a first-rate writer today.
sentences.chinese: 他是當今第一流的作家。

sentences.english: Hillary Clinton's returns from Asia having made a first-class debut.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在亞洲展現了第一流的初次亮相。

sentences.english: This restaurant is top-drawer . They serve the best food in town.
sentences.chinese: 這家餐廳是第一流的，他們供應全鎮最好的食物。

sentences.english: Rehhagel is a first-class coach – in the second division at least.
sentences.chinese: 雷哈格爾是第一流的主教練，至少也是第二名。

sentences.english: To this caravanserai came the best of the political and social patronage of the State.
sentences.chinese: 這個大旅館，是本州政治和社會的第一流人物所住的。

sentences.english: You are a shark of the first order, Euripides. So much the better for the firm!
sentences.chinese: 你可算得是第一流的奸商，這也是咱公司的造化。

sentences.english: But the thing was, how to get into the first-class magazines.
sentences.chinese: 問題在怎樣打進第一流雜誌。

sentences.english: Plantronics Encore H91N is a top-of-the-line model that offers all-day comfort and superior sound quality.
sentences.chinese: 提供全天舒適感和優美音質的第一流型號。

sentences.english: He is a swell tennis player.
We can enjoy the first-rate acting in that theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我們能在那家戲院看到第一流的表演。

sentences.english: VERK is ready to provide its customers with first class service in the fields of machine-building.
sentences.chinese: 沃瑞克在機牀領域給客戶提供第一流的產品和服務。

sentences.english: Offer it to the first-class houses.
sentences.chinese: 把它寄給第一流的出版社。

sentences.english: It is evident that you belong to the first circles.
sentences.chinese: 你毫無問題是屬於第一流的人材。

sentences.english: Seth and Jill went to a first-rate restaurant for their anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 賽斯和吉兒去一間第一流的餐館慶祝他們結婚週年。

sentences.english: The electronics products were first-rate and eagerly embraced.
sentences.chinese: 人們急切地想擁有這些第一流的電子產品。

definition: the present age/in office/the current office holder
erhua variant of 頂尖|顶尖[ding3 jian1]
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
top quality/front ranking
reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
to be considered as outstanding or special/to be reckoned with/notable
unsurpassed/extreme/extraordinary
world famous
second-rate/second-tier
to excel the common (idiom); surpassing/preeminent/outstanding
first under heaven/number one in the country
person of outstanding talent
first-class/best quality/also pr. [shang4 sheng4]
unequalled in his time
to make reference to/to write about
famous/celebrated
